intro: Earina plana, commonly known as the flat earina, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands. Its leaves are usually broad and flat, contributing to its common name. Earina plana is noted for its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer.
